content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a differentiable function such that <math alttext="f prime of x is greater than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≥</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="a is less than b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></math>, which of the following statements could be false?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of b, minus f of a, and denominator b minus a, end fraction, is greater than or equal to 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle><mo>≥</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f of b, is greater than f of a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

There is a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> such that <math alttext="f of c equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>.

There is a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> such that <math alttext="f of c equals, the fraction with numerator f of a, plus f of b, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.

content.answer: There is a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, a comma b, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> such that <math alttext="f of c equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>.
